Overview.Summary: The 70th British Academy Film Awards were held in London and were presented by the British Academy of Film and Television Arts (BAFTA) (4). The awards ceremony took place in February of 2017 and was attended by actress Emma Stone (2). The film "The Best Exotic Marigold Hotel" was named Outstanding British Film (3). Singer and musician Sir Elton John was also mentioned (4).

Timeline.Text: The 70th EE British Academy Film Awards (BAFTA) are held at Royal Albert Hall in London.
Two British films, The Best Exotic Marigold Hotel and Skyfall, are both nominated for Best British Film at the BAFTA awards.
John Furnish, husband of Elton John, attends the BAFTA awards as a member of the British Film Institute.
Emma Stone wins Best Actress at the BAFTA awards for her role in La La Land.
La La Land, along with a number of other films, is nominated for Best Adapted Screenplay at the European Film Awards.

Overview.Summary: The 70th British Academy Film Awards were held on February 12, 2017 at the Royal Albert Hall in London (6). Sylvain Chomet's film "The Old Lady and the Pigeons" won the Academy Award for Best Animated Short Film at the event (1,5). British actor Daniel Kaluuya was the favorite to win Best Actor for his role in "Get Out" at the awards (4). The awards also recognized the film "A United Kingdom" (8,9,10), starring David Oyelowo and directed by Amma Asante. The event was covered by various media outlets such as the Guardian in the United Kingdom (9) and the International Movie Database (6).

Timeline.Text: The 70th British Academy Film Awards take place, with Royal Albert Hall hosting the event.
David Oyelowo, lead actor of A United Kingdom, wins the Best Actor prize at the Academy Awards.
The Guardian makes headlines in the United Kingdom with their article on adult entertainment.
Last year's Best Film Drama announcement occurs, and Hacksaw Ridge, led by Andrew Garfield, wins multiple Academy Awards.
Sylvain Chomet's "The Old Lady and the Pigeons" debuts, eventually leading to 29 Academy Award wins for Pixar Animation Studios over time.
The 70th Academy Awards ceremony, at which The Eagle, adapted from Juliet Stevenson's novel of the same name, wins several more prizes.
Animation film A Giant in Paris, a musical comedy-adventure movie that was released in 2011, is introduced to the public.
Members and fans of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences create a film club, drawing nearly 30 members out of 6 out of the 14 active AMPAS groups.

Overview.Summary: Preparations began for the 70th annual BAFTA Awards (1, 5). The BAFTA Awards took place on February 12, 2017 at the Royal Albert Hall and were hosted by the British Academy of Film and Television Arts (3, 9, 10). The awards were under way in London and were in contention with Emma Stone, Ryan Gosling, and La La Land (1, 5, 8). Other notable films in competition included Verdi Rigoletto (4).The ceremony was also notable for the revival of actress Catherine Deneuve's international career (6).

Several well-known actors and actresses attend the British Academy Film Awards at the Royal Albert Hall.
The British Academy Film Awards feature nominees and winners from a diverse range of films.
The results and commentary on Academy Award winning movies are featured in The Guardian.

The British Academy Film Awards present the nominations and winner for Best Foreign Language Film.

Overview.Summary: The 70th British Academy Film Awards event was held on February 12, 2017 and was hosted by Stephen Fry (3). The event featured various nominees and winners, including Emma Stone, Ryan Gosling, and Dev Patel (3). Anne Hathaway also attended the event (9). Johnny Depp, Helena Bonham Carter, and Alan Rickman were among the cast of nominated films (9). The event was a merger of the British Film Academy, which was first awarded to Sir David Lean (10).

Timeline.Text: Preparations are underway for the 70th annual BAFTA Awards, which will be hosted by Stephen Fry.
Anne Hathaway attends the 70th Golden Globes Awards, one of the most glamorous nights of the awards season.
Johnny Depp, Helena Bonham Carter, Anne Hathaway, Stephen Fry, and Alan Rickman star in 'Alice in Wonderland', directed by Tim Burton.
Damien Chazelle wins a BAFTA for Outstanding British Film for 'La La Land'.
Actress Sophie McShera wears a dress inspired by Kate Middleton to the BAFTA Awards.
Actor Daniel Day-Lewis attends the BAFTA Awards.
Cheshire Cat - Stephen Fry - appears in the film 'Alice in Wonderland'.
Composer Ed Bainbridge celebrates his 70th birthday.
A trailer for the film adaptation of Stephen King's 'It' is released, featuring a child-devouring clown.

Overview.Summary: The 70th British Academy Film Awards took place on February 12, 2017 and was televised on BBC One (3). The Duchess of Cambridge made her debut at the awards ceremony (5,6). The awards honored various actors, including Eddie Redmayne who was a nominee for Best Actor (10). The Society of Film and Television Arts merged with the British Film Academy to form the British Academy of Film and Television Arts (5).

subjects: British Academy of Film and Television Arts

Timeline.Text: British actor Eddie Redmayne is a nominee for BAFTA's Best Actor award for his role in the film The Danish Girl.
The British Academy of Film and Television Arts (BAFTA) hosts their 70th annual film awards, with actress Emma Stone and others making appearances.
Film Studies For Free features a post on British cinema and its impact on the Academy Awards.
The Duchess of Cambridge attends the British Academy of Film and Television Arts with Prince William, where they make their first debut at the glamorous awards ceremony.
The British Academy of Film and Television Arts awards are held at Royal Albert Hall, where winners including Sylvain Chomet are announced.
Actor Warren Beatty reveals that his film La La Land mistakenly won the Academy Award for Best Picture during last month's ceremony.

Overview.Summary: The 70th British Academy Film Awards was held on February 12, 2017 and celebrated David Bowie's 70th birthday (5). The film La La Land won five Bafta awards, continuing its Oscar momentum (9). The awards ceremony was also notable for being the first major event to take place at the new Royal Albert Hall (7). No film attempted to replicate the success of Slumdog Millionaire in 2009 by winning both the People's Choice Award at the Toronto Film Festival and the Oscar for Best Picture (10). On the other hand, the animation category remains elusive for director Wes Anderson who filmed The Isle of Dogs in England (10).

Timeline.Text: David Bowie's 70th birthday concerts are announced for January 8.
Actress Gemma Jones, best known for her role in British film and television, passes away at the age of 70.
Oscar-winning composer Hans Zimmer celebrates his 60th birthday on February 9.
Actress and Academy Award winner Luise Rainer passes away at the age of 104, remembered for her groundbreaking performance in 1937's 'The Great Ziegfeld'.
Possible films for the Cannes Film Festival are already being speculated, including British and American works.
The cast of 'General Hospital' celebrates their 70th year on television.

Overview.Summary: Preparations are underway for the 70th annual BAFTA Awards, where Tony Zhou's "Mission Not Quite Accomplished" may not make the cut for the Oscar In Memoriam segment unlike in 2003 (5). The film "Zero Dark Thirty" was nominated for one of the Best Picture flub at last month's Academy Awards (2, 4). "Mission Impossible 6" and Rupert Sanders' "Rub and Chug" are the post-Oscar films about to be nominated for four Academy Awards (8). The film "Ben-Hur" would have garnered more Oscar glory thanks to its huge budget that made it virtually conquer the world of CGI (9). Planet of the Wars may be the 2001-2002 BAFTA winner for Best Live-Action Short Film (3). Director Andrew Payne stars in one of the projects, which is what won the 2008 German Writing Turnaround Award (8). Kate Middleton, the Duchess of Cambridge, wore the 70th annual BAFTA Awards in a Comcast product placement effort as at the Yale Center for British Art in Connecticut via Gawker this year (10).

Timeline.Text: The British Academy Film Awards (BAFTAs) take place, with Life of Pi, Lincoln, and Zero Dark Thirty among the nominees.
Stan Winston, a special effects make-up artist who has won multiple Academy Awards, passes away.

François Truffaut, a French film director known for his work in the French New Wave and for his close collaboration with actor Jean-Pierre Léaud, passes away on what would have been his 70th birthday.
Superman celebrates his 70th birthday.
Preparations for the upcoming 70th British Academy Film Awards take place.
Mexican-born American actor Ramon Novarro, best known for his roles in silent films such as The Sheik and Ben-Hur, would have celebrated his 70th birthday if he were still alive.
The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge attend the 70th British Academy Film Awards, with Prince William serving as President of the Academy.

Overview.Summary: The 70th British Academy Film Awards were held on February 10, 2011 and were a mix of animation and CGI (8). Stan Winston won 4 Oscars and conquered the world of animation and 3 more were awarded for categories such as Best Score (7). There are nominees for the 85th Academy Awards.

Timeline.Text: Sylvain Chomet's animated short film "The Old Lady and the Pigeons" wins awards at the César Awards and Academy Awards.
Kevin Smith becomes a member of the Academy of the Overrated.
British historian Hugo Vickers shares insights about his role as historical advisor on the film "The King's Speech".
Stan Winston, special effects make-up wizard, passes away.
The 70th British Academy Film Awards take place.
"Knickerbocker Holiday", a satiric musical composed by Erich Wolfgang Korngold about the Dutch settlement of New Amsterdam, is renamed and turned over to the British.
Richard Rodgers, composer of the musical score for "Victory at Sea", receives the 5th annual Special Achievement Academy Award.
The nominees for the 85th Academy Awards are announced.

Overview.Summary: The 70th British Academy Film Awards will take place on February 3rd, 2013 at the Royal Opera House (6), where Anna Karenina and Les Miserables (6) are in contention for the Outstanding British Film award (6,7). Additionally, Hugh Jackman and Judi Dench star in Les Miserables and are up for best actor/actress (6).

Timeline.Text: The 70th annual BAFTA Awards are prepared for takeoff.
The production of the 70th British Academy Film Awards is criticized for its overrated nominee picks.
Fans of online games leverage the recent awards for an opportunity to place their bets.
On the date of his 70th birthday, an interview is released featuring Count Jan of Luxembourg.
The first-ever BAFTA Awards show-within-a-show attracts major audiences through the appealing T2 Trainspotting - Cinema Review release.
The French website "Flooby Nooby" features commentary on the American and Canadian VHS releases of debut director Sylvain Chomet's atrocious, The Old Lady and the Pigeons.
Online gaming elites and music lovers unite through the Marriage Law of this year's "Valentine Moon."
Record executive Yabot Little experiences a transformative moment through dedicated artist and human longevity participant, Madonna.
"The cemetary of forgotten articles" has its birthday honored at the Academy Awards.
CEO Elon Musk signs in as a provisionary member of The British National Academy.
